description:
Persons in employment (domestic concept)

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
13311 Regional employment accounts

Definition:
Employment is presented in terms of an annual average in
accordance with the domestic concept (place-of-work
concept). All persons are covered whose place of residence
and place of work are in the relevant geographic area, and
additionally all non-residents (commuters) working in this
area. Employment covers all persons engaged in productive
activity that falls within the production boundary of the
national accounts.
Persons in employment are employees or self-employed
persons. Persons holding more than one job are classified as
employees or self-employed according to their main job.
(European System of National and Regional Accounts (ESA
2010), Chapter 11) In accordance with the definition of the
International Labour Organization (ILO), too, any person at
working age is considered to be in employment if he or she
worked for pay, as self-employed or as a family worker for
at least one hour in the one-week reference period. Hence,
it is irrelevant whether the employment is the persons main
source of livelihood. Persons in formal employment who were
temporarily not able to perform their job in the reference
period are regarded as being in employment.
